personalInfo.clubAffl: Auburn University Club (Auburn, Georgia); Swainsboro GC

tourBios.carHigh: Only Tour-related start came on the Nationwide Tour, where he missed the cut in the 2005 Xerox Classic in Rochester, NY...Has also played on the Hooters Tour and the Tarheel Tour.
tourBios.otherCarHigh: Played four years at Auburn University, where he was a member of the Tigers' 2002 Southeastern Conference Championship team. Tigers finished fourth his freshman year and third in 2003. Named to the SEC Academic Honor Roll...Helped Swainsboro High School team win four consecutive regional championships...Named to the 1999 Polo Golf Junior All-America team.
tourBios.personal: Lists Scott Hamilton and Hank Johnson as instructors...Biggest thrill in golf was being a part of Auburn's SEC Championship team in 2002. Biggest thrill away from the game is getting married...Says Seaside GC in Sea Island, GA, is his favorite and would like to play Augusta National...Never travels without his fishing pole...Superstitions include always marking his ball with a 1981 quarter...Favorite teams are the Auburn Tigers and Atlanta Falcons. Favorite TV show is "Criminal Minds" and "Joe Dirt" is his favorite movie. Morgan Freeman is his favorite actor and Michael Jordan his favorite athlete to watch. Steak is his favorite food. Rochester, NY, is his favorite city to visit and St. Lucia and Breckenridge, CO, are his favorite vacation spots...Would round out his dream foursome with his father, Michael Jordan and Tiger Woods...Grew up on a nine-hole golf course...Bucket list includes winning on the PGA TOUR and starting a family...Charity work is with American Cancer Societ through Relay for Life...Attended Swainsboro (GA) High School...Has one sister.

tourBios.carHigh:
2014-15: Did not make a start during the PGA TOUR season while continuing to recover from left-hip surgery. Will have 12 events in the 2015-16 PGA TOUR Season to earn 386 FedExCup points or $655,459 to clear the top finishers from Web.com Tour Medical category.

2013-14: Made the cut in four of eight PGA TOUR starts, with his best finish coming at The McGladrey Classic (T40). Ended the year No. 213 in the FedExCup standings.

2013: Best PGA TOUR finish in the first half of the year was a T27 at the HP Byron Nelson Championship...He closed his TOUR season with a T16 at the Reno-Tahoe Open and a T29 at the Wyndham Championship...Made nine cuts in 24 starts. Finished the season 169th in FedExCup points and $206,722 in earnings...On the Web.com Tour, playing in the first event of the four-tournament Finals, enjoyed four rounds in the 60s, which produced a T7 at the Hotel Fitness Championship in Indiana.

2012: Finished the season No. 102 in the FedExCup standings...Shot an opening, 5-under 66 to take a share of the lead at the Mayakoba Golf Classic. Went on to T9 in Mexico...Played Annandale GC's par-5 18th hole in 7-under on the week (three eagles and a birdie) to finish T5 at the True South Classic in July. With rounds of 67-67-68-68, it marked the first time in the rookie's career he had posted four consecutive rounds in the 60s in an event...Advanced to the PGA TOUR Playoffs but missed the cut at The Barclays and failed to advance to the Deutsche Bank Championship...Made the cut in four fall events, with a T27 at The McGladrey Classic his best showing. 2011: In his only PGA TOUR start, the Transitions Championship, finished T67...Made nine Web.com Tour starts, posting one top-20 finish, a T17 at the Mexico Open, in his second start of the season...In December, he opened with an 8-under 64 at the PGA TOUR Qualifying Tournament at PGA West en route to a T18 finish, earning him his PGA TOUR card for 2012. 2010: Made 13 of 17 cuts on the NGA Hooters Tour. 2009: Finished 70th on the eGolf Tour money list, with his lone top-10 finish a T8 at the Cabarrus Classic in Charlotte, N.C...Also played part time on the NGA Hooters Tour. 2008: In 16 starts on the NGA Hooters Tour, he made 13 cuts and had a T3 performance as his top finish. 2007: Played mainly on the NGA Hooters Tour. 2005: Played in his first Web.com Tour event, the Xerox Classic, where he missed the cut. He would not make another appearance on that Tour until 2011. Amateur: Played four years at Auburn University, where he was a member of the Tigers' 2002 Southeastern Conference Championship team. The Tigers finished fourth his freshman year and third in 2003. Named to the SEC Academic team...Helped his Swainsboro High School golf team win four consecutive regional championships...Named to the 1999 Polo Golf Junior All-America team.
tourBios.personal: Biggest thrill away from the game is getting married...Says Seaside GC in Sea Island, Ga., is his favorite course and someday hopes to play Augusta National...Never travels without his fishing pole...Favorite teams are the Auburn Tigers and Atlanta Falcons. Favorite TV show is "Criminal Minds," and "The Shawshank Redemption" is his favorite movie. Morgan Freeman is his favorite actor, and Michael Jordan his favorite athlete to watch. He enjoys eating steak and likes visiting Rochester, N.Y. Favorite vacation spots are St. Lucia in the Caribbean and Lake Tahoe...Would round out his dream foursome with his father, Jack Nicklaus and Tiger Woods...Grew up on a nine-hole golf course...Bucket list includes winning on the PGA TOUR...Supports Jason Dufner Charitable Foundation and Mission Ministries...Attended Swainsboro (Ga.) High School...Has one sister...Usually carries a cinnamon, raisin and peanut butter sandwich in his bag.

dyn.dynResults: His best finish on the PGA TOUR was T5th in 2012 at the True South Classic.
